abstract: Senior Obama administration officials are wrestling with how to handle an explosive executive pay issue involving two traders’ compensation package of nearly $130 million that Citigroup says is exempt from government review.
snippet: Senior Obama administration officials are wrestling with how to handle an explosive executive pay issue involving two traders’ compensation package of nearly $130 million that Citigroup says is exempt from government review.
lead_paragraph: Senior Obama administration officials were wrestling Friday with how to handle an explosive executive pay issue involving two traders’ compensation package of nearly $130 million that Citigroup says is exempt from government review, The New York Times’s Stephen Labaton and Eric Dash reported.

headline.main: U.S. Weighs Action Over Citi’s $100 Million Man
